title: Marcel Couturier 2014 Vielles Vignes  (Pouilly-Loché)
description: This is a spicy wine, with balanced wood, yellow-fruit flavors and acidity that cuts through the spice and ripeness. A zing of citrus finishes this attractive wine in style.

title: François Buffet 2014 Les Narbantons Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: This wine is fragrant and ripe while having a balanced, delicate structure. It offers plenty of fruit and acidity, with dusty tannins and sweet berry flavors. It should develop well and quickly. Drink from 2019.

title: Michael Shaps 2012 Tannat (Monticello)
description: Vibrant, dense purple in color, this is ultraconcentrated on the nose, offering kirsch, blueberry reduction and dusty-earth aromas. The palate is heavy, rich and laden with dark fruit, yet there's a balance of grainy tannins and snappy acidity to keep the weight in check.

title: Kristodd 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Lively acidity defined by a taste of lemon peel meets heftier overtones of fresh pear, providing a medium-bodied texture that should work well at the table. The finish highlights the lemony aspects of the wine.

title: Quady North 2011 Arsenal Red (Rogue Valley)
description: Quady's Right Bank blend is three-quarters Cabernet Franc and one-quarter Merlot. Smoky and showing a lightly funky scent when opened, it develops into a leathery and tannic red wine, checkered with red and black fruits, hints of tobacco and a vein of graphite.

title: Quinta da Raza 2015 Alvarinho-Trajadura Grande Escolha White (Vinho Verde)
description: Dominated by Alvarinho, this is a spicy, fruity and tangy wine. It is still young with a tight mineral edge that will soften to bring out a more creamy character. The after-taste, with its fresh citrus, should remain. Drink from 2017.

title: Paul O'Brien 2013 Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)
description: Pure varietal, this was fermented in oak uprights and aged for two years in one-third new French and Hungarian oak. The oak accents complement tart flavors of raspberry and pomegranate. Give this another year or two of bottle age, and drink with pleasure from 2018 to 2025.

title: Paul O'Brien 2015 Rosato Rosé (Umpqua Valley)
description: Despite the low abv, this is a dry rosé, made from 100% Sangiovese that was picked at 20.5 brix. It's delicate and satisfying—a pretty pale copper/rose color, with flavors of strawberry hinting at peach. There's a dusting of baking spices and cocoa, adding welcome highlights to the finish.

title: Shumi Winery 2014 Saperavi (Kakheti)
description: Deeply red-violet in the glass, this wine offers a bouquet of black cherry and fennel. There is a sense of coolness in the mouth, with flavors of blueberry, blackberry, white chocolate, espresso and lavender. Tannins are soft but ever-present, and the smooth finish has a burst of orange zest.

title: Verum 2014 Malbec (Alto Valle del Río Negro)
description: Wiry aromas of cherry and plum are forward and demanding. This is gravelly and a touch jagged in feel, with ripe, nicely proportioned plum and berry flavors. Baked, muscled-up qualities are spread evenly throughout this beefy Patagonian Malbec.

title: Vietti 2012 Ravera  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of underbrush, grilled herb, cured meat and a balsamic note emerge in the glass. The tightly wound palate offers dark berry, licorice, sage and ground pepper alongside austere, astringent tannins that grip the finish.

title: Roadhouse Winery 2014 Purple Label Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Big tannin and burly toasted oak make for a full-bodied, robust entry into this concentrated wine. It offers an undeniable hit of Dr. Pepper and wild mushrooms grown on a forest floor.

title: Vinoterra 2012 Kisi (Kakheti)
description: Amber in color, this wine offers a simple bouquet of guava and mango that belies its complexity on the palate. It is refreshing at first sip, with flavors of passion fruit, mango, grapefruit and lemon curd that are at play amid subdued yet persistent tannins. A tropical fruit flourish makes its presence known on the last note of the finish.

title: Schuchmann Wines 2014 Rkatsiteli (Kakheti)
description: Pale straw to the eye, this wine has aromas of peach and acacia blossoms. It offers good mouthfeel with flavors of white peach, pineapple and almond blossom and a bright finish.

title: Z. Alexander Brown 2013 Uncaged Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Simply delicious fruit flavors accented by fresh mint and a texture as soft as suede make this medium-bodied wine hard to resist. Ripe black cherry and blackberry notes seem broad and soothing, with just enough tannin to keep it balanced.

title: Bridlewood 2013 Reserve Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: A dark wine, this shows tightly wound blackberry and boysenberry fruit on the nose as well as a touch of tar, concentrated violets, smoked pork and beef char. The mouthfeel is full and rich, with deeply fruity flavors of blackberry paste spiced up by peppercorn and strong acidity. It's a very solid, down-the-middle Syrah.

title: Cadus 2013 Gualtallary Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Horsey leather aromas are a big part of this Malbec's nose, which also includes vanilla and blackberry scents. Creamy and thick on the palate, this delivers meaty berry flavors that come with notes of root beer and chocolate. Round, warm, beefy berry flavors form the finish.

title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2015 Colheita Seleccionada Arinto (Vinho Verde)
description: The Arinto grape, also known as Paderna in Vinho Verde, has produced a rich full wine with yellow fruit and ripe apple flavors. It is a generous wine, full of fruit with a final burst of lime acidity. Drink now.

title: Brassfield 2013 Volcano Ridge Vineyard Petite Sirah (High Valley)
description: Big, dark and very young, this full-bodied wine has an extremely deep color, plus aromas like salt and pepper and grilled beef. Concentrated flavors suggest blackberry and dark chocolate, and the texture is wrapped in drying tannins. It will be best after 2020.

title: Château Vartely 2015 D'Or White (Codru Region)
description: This Moldovan white blend has aromas of cut grass, apricot and peach. In the mouth there are flavors of honeysuckle, canned peaches and fresh apricot before the crisp and clean finish.

title: Christophe Cordier 2014  Mâcon-Milly Lamartine
description: Nutmeg and cinnamon balance well with the apple flavors and crisp texture of this wine, which is refreshing, crisp and lively with acidity and plenty of fruitiness. It is attractive and ready to drink.

title: Christophe Cordier 2014 Vielles Vignes  (Viré-Clessé)
description: Plenty of toastiness in this ripe wine gives an extra element of acidity that needs to be tamed. At the same time, it has good white- and citrus-fruit flavors. Drink this attractive wine from 2017.

title: Clos LaChance 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)
description: This affordably priced bottling is quite solid for the cost, showing deep black cherry, blueberry, cedar shavings, tobacco leaf and ash, cocoa and slight bay leaf on the nose. Chalky tannins show first on the sip, and then unwind to offer blackberry fruit, woody pencil shavings and a decent density.

title: Domaine des Crets 2014  Mâcon-Villages
description: This wine is warm with touches of wood and spice. Juicy pear and apple flavors are filled out with white peach, while the toast gives extra complexity and richness. The wine, from the first vintage in this newly named domaine by François Lequin (Lequin-Colin) and Matthieu Ponson, is attractive now, but will be better from 2017.

title: Caves da Montanha 2014 Conde de Serpa Colheita Red (Alentejano)
description: Named after an advisor to the 19th-century Portuguese kings, this red wine is rich and full of dark fruits, with juicy acidity. It has a fine, ripe character, with generous tannins integrated into the full-bodied character. The acidity at the end gives a final crisper aftertaste.

title: Chaman 2014 Petit Verdot (La Consulta)
description: Raspberry and plum aromas are earthy, intriguing and suggest fresh cement. This PV feels a bit clampy and syrupy in weight. Flavors of herbal berry, plum, toast and pepper finish with manageable tannins. Overall this is uncomplicated and quite good for something that's off the grid.

title: Alex Gambal 2014 Dents du Chien Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)
description: Wood and ripe yellow fruits dominate this attractive, ripe wine. Spice and richness suggest it will become full and round as it develops. Ripe and generous, it will be ready from 2017.

title: Bodega Calle 2012 Ca' de Calle Gran Reserva Red (Mendoza)
description: A full, minty nose is pushy, with notes of baked plum and clove. Round, spongy, tannic and with racy acidity, this Malbec-led blend shows good balance and snappy flavors of red-berry fruits, mint and spice. A tannic finish feels raw and elastic.

title: Erzsébet Pince 2012 Estate Furmint (Tokaj)
description: This dry Furmint has aromas of lemon curd, vanilla, fresh apricot and canned peaches and flavors of apples, peach and apricot preserves. It has a crisp clean finish.

title: Finca Sophenia 2015 Chardonnay (Tupungato)
description: This is immediately ripe and wooly, with touches of lanolin and apricot on the nose. Plump but also citrusy in feel, this sports a citrusy flavor profile built on orange and offset by a tropical hint of banana. Racy, solid and healthy on the finish.
